title: Introduction to Continuous Improvement
headline: This free online course explains how to improve business and project processes to reduce waste and boost efficiency.
description: Are you seeking ways to improve the processes within your organisation and boost productivity? Do you want to increase customer satisfaction? This course will teach you the concept of continuous improvement and the tools used to deploy it to enhance business processes. We analyse the aim of an audit, the essence of good communication among workers and the importance of tools in achieving continuous improvement.

courseDescription:
Are you sick and tired of low-quality results and poor productivity? Do you invest so much time and effort in processes, yet little comes out of it? Continuous improvement (CI) constantly assesses and evaluates processes to ensure maximum productivity and efficiency. Low productivity points to possible omissions, waste and errors within operations. CI therefore  seeks to alleviate waste and errors and enhance productivity. This course teaches you the fundamental concepts of continuous improvement used to perpetually examine processes to improve them for better productivity and efficiency. First, we introduce you to CI and then distinguish between CI and business improvement (BI). Next, we'll demonstrate the extensive toolkits that CI and BI have at their disposal. Following that, you'll learn about the purposes and benefits of CI in enhancing processes in businesses and projects.

When deploying CI in projects and businesses, there are several methodologies to employ, such as Six Sigma, Lean, Total Quality Management (TQM), the ‘Plan Do Check Act’ (PDCA), Theory of Constraint (TOC) and more. These methodologies have different approaches to reducing waste and errors and improving quality. You'll study the aim and practice of these methodologies. Do you observe constraints within your processes, such as an unskilled team member? We'll teach you how to employ the concept of TOC to eradicate such limitations within your team and in turn improve processes. You will explore the ‘Kaizen workshop’ and how to use it to quickly solve a problem, reduce spending, improve quality, shorten delivery time or improve customer satisfaction.

A ‘Gemba Walk’ is a workplace walkthrough in which you observe employees, ask questions about their tasks and identify productivity gains. You'll gain an in-depth understanding of the Gemba Walk methodology and how to conduct it to ensure the CI of a process. You'll learn how to use the skills matrix document to help your team members improve their skills, what a process owner is and their responsibilities. You'll explore the importance of communication within a process, the three key traits required for excellent communication and the value of tools in deploying CI. You don't need any prior knowledge to take this course. It is for everyone, especially business managers. If you want to utilise CI to improve your organisation's operations, enrol and start this course today.

Start Course Now

All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this certificate course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this certificate course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison certificate is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital certificate: a downloadable certificate in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked certificate, posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security marked certificate in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.
Start Course Now

All certificate are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison certificate, please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison certificate, you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you’ll be introduced to the concept of continuous improvement and the differences between continuous improvement and business improvement. You’ll learn about the purposes and benefits of CI and the tools used to deploy it. Learn about the importance of good communication among workers and the importance of tools used to deploy CI.
topics: CI Initiative, Teams, Communications and Tools

modules.name: Module
topics: Introduction to Continuous Improvement - Course Assessment

slides:
• Learning Outcomes

  • Upon completion of this module, you should be able to:
    • Define continuous improvement.
    • Differentiate between continuous improvement and business improvement.
    • List the purposes and benefits of continuous improvement.
    • Discuss the methodologies used in the deployment of continuous improvement.
    • Recognise those who developed the Six Sigma and total quality management methodologies used to deploy continuous improvement.
    • Outline the purpose of an audit.
    • Summarise the responsibilities of a process owner.
    • Recognise the aim of the kaizen workshop in continuous improvement.
    • Identify the key traits required for great communication.
    • Recall the importance of tools in deploying continuous improvement.

  • Lesson Summary

  • Here are the key points in this module:
    • CI is the continual improvement of processes, operations, departments, teams and SLA/KPI (Service-level agreement/key performance indicator) performance.
    • CI reduces the need for large-scale projects, disruption to teams and the need to hire consultants.
    • The benefits of CI: reduced cost, shift to value add, reduced waste, enables faster delivery, stronger culture, better quality, risk reduction, innovation, more competition, error reduction, risk reduction, improved morale and improved CSAT (customer satisfaction score).
    • Six Sigma is an approach that focuses on data to reduce variation and defects within an organisation or process.
    • Lean is an approach that focuses on reducing waste, waiting and saving time and money. This is not about a problem or issue necessarily, but is focused on increasing productivity and efficiency.
    • Total quality management is an approach whose focus is on delivering an organisation-wide effort to focus on CI.
    • The theory of constraints is a systematic process focused on finding and eliminating the key constraints to a process or performance.
    • Plan Do Check Act is an approach that delivers a systematic step-by-step process to identify the change needed and to change it.

  • Lesson Summary

  • Here are the key points in this module:

    • CI reduces the need for large-scale projects, disruption to teams and the need to hire consultants.
    • The benefits of CI: reduced cost, shift to value add, reduced waste, enables faster delivery, stronger culture, better quality, risk reduction, innovation, more competition, error reduction, risk reduction, improved morale and improved CSAT (customer satisfaction score).
    • Six Sigma is an approach that focuses on data to reduce variation and defects within an organisation or process.
    • Lean is an approach that focuses on reducing waste, waiting and saving time and money. This is not about a problem or issue necessarily, but is focused on increasing productivity and efficiency.
    • Total quality management is an approach whose focus is on delivering an organisation-wide effort to focus on CI.
    • The theory of constraints is a systematic process focused on finding and eliminating the key constraints to a process or performance.
    • Plan Do Check Act is an approach that delivers a systematic step-by-step process to identify the change needed and to change it.
